THE COLLEGE IS A MEMBER OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES (NAICU). NAICU SERVES AS THE UNIFIED NATIONAL VOICE OF INDEPENDENT HIGHER EDUCATION. SINCE 1976, THE ASSOCIATION HAS REPRESENTED PRIVATE COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES ON POLICY ISSUES WITH THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT, SUCH AS THOSE AFFECTING STUDENT AID, TAXATION, AND GOVERNMENT REGULATION. NAICU'S 1,000 MEMBERS NATIONWIDE REFLECT THE DIVERSITY OF PRIVATE, NONPROFIT HIGHER EDUCATION IN THE UNITED STATES. MEMBERS INCLUDE TRADITIONAL LIBERAL ARTS COLLEGES, MAJOR RESEARCH UNIVERSITIES, CHURCH- AND FAITH-RELATED INSTITUTIONS, HISTORICALLY BLACK COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES, WOMEN'S COLLEGES, PERFORMING AND VISUAL ARTS INSTITUTIONS, TWO-YEAR COLLEGES, AND SCHOOLS OF LAW, MEDICINE, ENGINEERING, BUSINESS, AND OTHER PROFESSIONS.
